alert.note: Alert for Iron; Price (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 17 at 11:48PM CST until December 18 at 12:30AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CST FOR SOUTH CENTRAL IRON AND NORTHEASTERN PRICE COUNTIES... At 1148 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located 12 miles west of Squirrel Lake, or 13 miles south of Turtle Flambeau Flowage, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This snow squall will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Iron and northeastern Price Counties, including the following locations... Pike Lake. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
